metadata.Title: CVE-2022-34468 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description: An iframe that was not permitted to run scripts could do so if the userclicked on a javascript: link. This vulnerability affectsFirefox < 102, Firefox ESR < 91.11, Thunderbird < 102, and Thunderbird <91.11. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34468` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: thunderbird - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
